doc.field: <description type="note">Only unique items not reproduced elsewhere in The English Poetry Full-text Database included.</description>
Square brackets denote editorial insertions or emendations. Poems have been selectively extracted from the source text, and thus poem numbers are not sequential.

[Fifteenth Century Carols and other pieces by M. R. James and G. C. Macaulay] Poems taken from a Ms. at St. John's College, Cambridge, 5. 54. [II] [Of X and M and oyir too] Of X and M and oyir too Of I and E I syng all so X for cristys hym selfe was dyth As clerkys redyn in story ryth Qwan X and M w? word was lyth To saue us fro y? fendys [feng] M be gynnyth a gloryos name Mary moder w? owtyn fane Qwan X and M was borne in same Oure goy be gynnyth to spreng Of E I wyll syng [yer ?ete] On cristys cross y? letre was sette qwan X and E to geyir mette M and E in herte was woo I begynnyth y? name of Ion qa? X upon y? rode was done M and I stod styll alone And hys postyllys went hym fro y??? iiij letrys worchippe [?] we all for crist was borne in ox stalle to bryng us fro y? dewlys all w? hys wkles [III] [Nowell nowell ell ell] Nowell nowell ell ell I wys yt ys a wunder nowell Jhesu restyd in a may xl wekys and a day yer fore I may syng and say Nowell ell ell At y? feste of architriclyn Crist turnyd watyr in to wyn And yer fore xalle y?? song be myn Nowell ell ell Ihesu asse y? art hewyn kynge Grawnt vus alle y? dere blyssynge hosyll and schrift at owre endynge Nowell ell ell [IV] [A A A A gaude cely domina] A A A A gaude cely domina Mary myld for loue of y? Glad and blythe now may we be I ?ow telle os ?e may see Tua quinque gaudia y? fyrst Ioy y? was sente y? was qwan gabryelle gret y? and seyd mary of chastite Efficieris Grauida y? second Ioy it was full good qwan crist of y? toke flesch and blode w? outyn synne w? myld mode Enixa est puerpera y? iij Ioy was of grette myth qwan crist was on y? rode dyth dede and beryd for oure ryyth Surrexit die tersia y? iiij Ioy was on [holy Thurs]day qwan crist to hewyn toke y? way God and man y? is oure say Ascendit supra scidera y? v Ioy in y? gan lyth qwan y? were in hewyn w? him dyth All holy chyrche y? hast in myth In tua potencia [V] [A dere god qwat I am fayn] A dere god qwat I am fayn for I am madyn now gane y? endyr day I mete a clerke and he was wylly in hys werke he prayd me w? hym to herke and hys cownsell all for to lene I trow he cowd of gramery I xall now a good kyll wy for qwat I hade sicculy To warne hys wyll had I no may qwan he and me browt nuus [?] y? schete Of all hys wyll I hym lete Now wyll not my gyrdyll met a dere god qwat I xall say I xall sey to man and page y? I haue bene of pylgrymage Now wyll I not lete for no rage w? me a [?] clerk for to pley [VI] [A A A A salue caterina] A A A A salue caterina lystyn lordyngys qwatte I xall sey A grette maruell tell I may Of a louely medyn tell I may salue caterina Of god grace sche was full wys Sche was qweryd in hyr dewys Of all dottys y? were so wys Wundyr marwelys be godys grace y? is no woman in y?? plase A woman is y? of grace Thorow y? prayer of sent cataryne God send us a hows twyl in y? wordy lady and bryth and schene Y? sche in fyre was done Sche brent nere here nere hone Sche stod in hewen anone [VII] [I may syng and sey I wys] I may syng and sey I wys Gre mercy my owne [purse] In euery plas qwere y? I wende My purse is my owne frende y? for gladly may I syng Gre mercy my own purse Qwere so euer I goo in lond My purse is redy at my hond y? for y?? is a redy song vt supra Qwere so I walke be y? way My purse xall help me all vay y? for may I syng and say vt supra If I be out in y? cuntre And my purse be far fro me ya? most I on beggyng fle And far xall go and letyll xall haue And ?e wol w? fellechyp won Tay ?oure purse in ?ore bosom yan may I well my song vowyn [Gre mercy my own purse] [X] [Lollay lay lay lay my dere modyr lullay] Lollay lay lay lay my dere modyr lullay Lullay my chyld A chyld ys born e wys y? all y?? word xall blys hys joy xall neuer myse for Ihesu ys hys name On y? good ?owe morne y? blysfull chyld was borne to were a crown of thorne vt supra Of a madyn so good he toke both fleche and blod for us he deyd up on y? rode vt supra Of a medyn so trew he toke both fleche and hewe for us he deyd on a tre vt supra on y? estern morn all blyth he ros fro deth to lyue to make us all blyth vt supra On y? good fryday at non to y? deth he was done for us he deyd on tre vt supra [XI] [pray we to oure lady dere for here holy grace] pray we to oure lady dere for here holy grace Sche saw y??? women all bedene both for sorow and for tene Madys and wyuys and weduys in weme all be y?? fayre in face Women be both good and hend Clen curteys cumly and kend Yche a cumpany is wele amende yf a woman be in a plase Of a woman com all oure blys y? for I loue hem all I wys qwo so euer seyth on hem amys be god he gawyd in hys face Were a man in sore syynge A woman xall hym out bryng And w? a kys lesse hys mornyng and sette hym in solace y??? men arne falce fekyll in tho?th women be wood y? trow hem howt for welle y?? hote and hold it noth but spek in here song dere lady to y? son y? pray he synd y??? women os he wylle may for false men y? downe hym tray y? y?? sene he neuer in face [XII] [Now ys y? xij day com] Now ys y? xij day com Fadyr and son to gydyr wone y? holy gost w? hem is nowme in fere God send us all a gud new ?er I xall ?ow syng thoro hys my?ht Of a chyld y? is so fayr of sy?ht a mayd hym bare of cristynmes ny?ht so styll as ya was hys wyll iij kyngys y? cum of galily y? cum toward bedlem iude hym to sek and to se Be ny?ht y? was a semly sy?ht As yei cum w? yer offryng y? mete w? Erawd y? mody kyng he hasked hem of here cummynge y? syd and yus tyll hem he sayd fro qweyre cum ?e kynges iij owt of y? est as ?e may se to seke hym y? euer xall be of my?ht lord prince kyng and kni?ht I pray ?ow lordys all iij qwan ?e haue y? chyld se y? ?e cum ageyn be me and telythe qwere y? fayr chyld dwellyth kyng herawd we wyll not lete as y? hast seyd yt xall be sete we cum ageyn w? owte lete and tell qwer y? fayr chyld dwell qwan he had seyde hys lykyng Syr herawd y? mody kyng and forth y? wente w? y? offryng Be ny?th ye stere gaue hem ly?ht be y? stere y? schon so bry?ht y? iij kyngys tok wey ful ry?ht Be y? hape of y? chyld so bry?ht Thoro grace to y? holy place qwan yei? cum to holy place y? Ihesu and hys moder was yi? offryd to hym w? grete solace infer golde encens and myrre all y?? wer both blythe and glade qwan y?? hade her offryng made as y? holy gost hem bad and dedyn worschype god and redyn qwen y? lordyngys wer wente y? chyld an angell from hevyn sente to y? kyngys y? mad presente or day to tech hem y? waye my lord warnyth ?ow euery chone y? non of ?ow be herowde gone for yf ?e don ?e xall be slone and stroy and do ?ow mekyll noye Thoro y? my?ht of god verrey y? kyngys tokyn anodyr away owt yei cum or yt was day full ry?ht home yei cum y? ny?ht [XIII] [fadyr my wyll yt is] fadyr my wyll yt is nolo mortem peccatoris ffadyr I am y?n owyn chylde and born of mary meke and mylde fadyr now my wyll yt is nolo mortem peccatoris My hert is sore qwan I be thynk and se mene trespas and in syn synk for all y? is done amyse nolo mortem peccatoris y? falce fend w? all y? slente y wyll no more man kynde be schente Of hem y? getyst no ry?ht ywys vt supra Now mak we both ioy and myrtht In worschyp of cristys owyn byrtht y? is goddys owyn word ywys vt supra [XIV] [War y? war y? war y? wele] War y? war y? war y? wele Wemen be as trew as stele Stel is gud I sey no odyr So mowun wemen be kaymys brodyr ylk on lere schrewdnes at odyr wemen be os trew as stele Stel is gud in euery knyfe So kun y? women both flyte and stryfe Also yei cun ful wele lye wemen vt supra Stele is gud in euery nedyll So be y? wemen both falce and fekyll and os yer awyne ry?ht brytyll vt supra Stele is both fayr and bry?ht So be y? women be candyl ly?ht And som wyll both flyte and fy?ht vt supra Stel is gud in lond and watyr So cun y? women both den and flatyr and ?yt for ned to play y? faytur vt supra [XV] [Ay ay be y? day] Ay ay be y? day y wyll mak mery qwyll y may Qwyll mene haue her bornys full y? of y thynk my parte to pull for tofor y? kyngys wolle y? may both selye and be my fey for be yt werre or be yt pece for we may yt be neuer ye les lete hem sytte on y? hye dese To serue hem in hys may Me thynk y? word is wonder wery and fadyth as y? brymbyll bery y? for y wyll now but be mery how long I xall y can not sey Syrs and ?e do after me Car ?e not thow y? ?e the Now y red do aftyr me for Iak rekles is my name [XVI] [Now Ihesus rector anime] Now Ihesus rector anime ne cademus sustine God y? all y?? word has wro?th And w? precius blod hath both Of us synfull men haue thoute ne cademus sustine y? arth lord y? mad all thyng for all grace is in y? gouyrnyng y? saue us fro y? fendys fowndyng defensor noster domine We haue iij enmys qwen y? we wende y? werd y? fendys and y? flesch y? saue us fro hem y? we not schende Incidiantes deprime In all ?oure leue wyll are here we haue here wo trauyll and care mete drynke and cloth we haue no more pro nostro graui opere [XVII] [Nowell] Nowell y?? word is falce I dare wyll say and man xall fade as dose hay for as a flour it fallys away tunc non ualebit corpore tell me sothe qwo so canne qwan he hys dede qwat is he than qwere se ?e eny ryche dede man reuela mihi hodie y? plesyst hym both nyth and day and knele to serue hym wyll to pay he may not hym a good word say cum operitur puluere hys secutourys w? oute lete ?ow be mythouer sette y?? sey he ouyt so mykyll dette non potest solui integre qwan he is closyd in hys graue yan is he y? he may not craue Os he haue done so xall he haue oblitus paruo tempore And y? for man or y? hens wende dele y? good w? y? honde And thynke wyll dede man haue no frond tu miserecis anime lord ?yf us grace so to do here y? qwan we are broch on bere y? take oure sole y? y? both dere pendens alto arbore and gyfe us grace so to spende y? god y? y? on to us sende y? we may sey at oure last end laus summo regule [XVIII] [A newyr a newyr y? chyld was borne] A newyr a newyr y? chyld was borne fadyr of hewyn hys owyn son haue sende hys [kyngdom] for to clemyn y? chyld was borne y?? endyr nyth vus for to saue w? all is myth so blyssyd be tyme a newyr y? chyld was borne y?? endys day All of a clene madyn as ?ur tell may so blyssyd [be] fadyr of hewyn tur All of ane madyn our lord was borne All for to wyn y? Adam had forlorn Lullay my letyll chyld my own swete seynt [Man]y scharp schourys xall y? body hent lullay lay letyll chyld my own suete foode how xall I suffyr y? fayre body forto be rent on rode lullay lay letyll chyld we owth myrthys to make for many scharp schoures xall y? body schake lullay lay letyll chyld we out to mak myrth And so out euery cristen man to worchyp y? byrth blyssyd be y? modyr y? chyld bare about And so be y? modyr y? chyld gaue soke blyssyd be y? moder y? chyld cam to Benedicamus domino so blyssyd be y? tyme [XIX] [Nowell nowell ell ell] Nowell nowell ell ell I pray ?ow lystyn qwat I ?ow [tell] Ouer all gatis that I haff gon Amonge y? grovys so fayer and grene So ffayer a brownch yan know I non As Ivy ys and that I mene Ivy ys grene and wyl be grene Qwere so euer a grow in stok or ston y?? ffore I red ?ow so mut I cheue ?e loue well Ivy eueryschon I xall ?ow tell a reson quy ?e xall low Ivy and thynk no chame y? ffyrst lettre begynnyth w? I and ry?ht ?evyn so Ihesus name y? secund lettre ys a V I lykyn to Awmihty wyffe Modyr sche ys and maydyn trewe Non but on I y? euer bare lyffe y? thred lettre is an e I lykyn to emanuell That is to sey cryst w? vus be And euer more ffor to dwell As I lay in my bed alone A comely lady sent to me And be bad me rede y??? lettrys eueryschon and all y? bettre xuld I be All how holy be ?oure ffonn And wilde towch w? tray and tene Meof Yvy xall hym ouer gonne And ffayer burdys ouer be twene Ouer all gatys that I have gone Among y??? grouys ffayer and grene I have be wery son anon My botte sche was y? Ivy tre yus yus Ivy ffull ffayer I gan spelle So ffayer a brawnch know I non I pray ?ow tent qwat I ?ow tell And love well Ivy eueryschon
